lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Ace (Duke), a program that manages tasks and todos for the user.
* @param filepath The filepath in which the task list is stored and retrieved from.
* Thrown to indicate that an error has occurred in Duke.
* Thrown when a user input cannot be parsed due to being invalid or incorrectly formatted.
* Command that adds a task to the list of tasks.
* Constructs an AddCommand object that adds a task to the task list upon execution.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Adds the given task to the list, displays the result to the user, and saves the change to the list.
* @param ui The UI object responsible for user interaction.
* @param storage The Storage object responsible for saving the change.
* @throws FileSaveException If the change cannot be saved.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws FileSaveException {
* Abstract class that represents a command given by the user, which is performed upon calling execute().
* @param ui The UI object responsible for user interaction.
* @param storage The Storage object responsible for saving the change.
* @throws DukeException If an error is encountered during execution.
abstract public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException;
* Indicates whether the command is an exit command or not.
* @return True if the command is an exit command and false otherwise.
* Command that deletes a task from the list of tasks.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand object that deletes a task from the task list upon execution.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted.
* Deletes the given task from the list, displays the result to the user, and saves the change to the list.
* @param ui The UI object responsible for user interaction.
* @param storage The Storage object responsible for saving the change.
* @throws DukeException If the indexed task does not exist or the change cannot be saved.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
* Instructs UI object to display the exit message before closing Duke.
* @param ui The UI object responsible for user interaction.
* @param storage The Storage object responsible for retrieving/storing the list.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns true to indicate that this command is an exit command.
* Command that lists all tasks with titles that match a user provided keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword the user has provided to find matching tasks.
* Instructs UI object to display all tasks that match the keyword in a numbered list form.
* @param ui The UI object responsible for user interaction.
* @param storage The Storage object responsible for saving the change.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Command that lists all tasks in the list.
* Instructs UI object to display all tasks in the list in a numbered list.
* @param storage The Storage object responsible for retrieving/storing the list.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Command that marks the given task as complete.
* Constructs a MarkCommand object that marks the given task as complete upon execution.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked.
* Marks the given task as complete, displays the result to the user, and saves the change to the list.
* @param ui The UI object responsible for user interaction.
* @param storage The Storage object responsible for saving the change.
* @throws DukeException If the indexed task does not exist or the change cannot be saved.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
* Command that marks the given task as incomplete.
* Constructs a UnmarkCommand object that marks the given task as complete upon execution.
* @param index The index of the task to be unmarked.
* Marks the given task as incomplete, displays the result to the user, and saves the change to the list.
* @param ui The UI object responsible for user interaction.
* @param storage The Storage object responsible for saving the change.
* @throws DukeException If the indexed task does not exist or the change cannot be saved.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
* Thrown when the user input is not a valid command.
* Thrown when the user inputs a command with a missing piece of information.
* Responsible for parsing user input and identifying correctly formatted commands.
* Parses and identifies the command provided by the user.
* @param strCommand The user's command in String format.
* @return The Command object corresponding to the user's input.
* @throws DukeException If the user provides an invalid or incorrectly formatted command.
public static Command parse(String strCommand) throws DukeException {
throw new InvalidArgumentException("Not a valid number");
throw new InvalidArgumentException("Not a valid number");
throw new InvalidArgumentException("Not a valid number");
throw new MissingArgumentException("Missing name and time");
throw new MissingArgumentException("Missing name and time");
throw new MissingArgumentException("Missing keyword or keyphrase");
throw new InvalidCommandException("Not an understood command");
* Thrown when the list of tasks cannot be saved to a file.
* Thrown when a task list is loaded from a file that does not exist.
* Responsible for loading the list of tasks from an existing and saving changes in the list to that file.
* Constructs a Storage object with a filepath that it will reference for retrieving/storing data.
* Loads the task list from the filepath provided during Storage construction.
* @return The ArrayList of tasks in the provided file.
* @throws DukeException If the file cannot be parsed or does not exist.
* Writes all tasks in the given list to filepath.
* @throws FileSaveException If the tasks cannot be stored in the respective file.
public void write(ArrayList<Task> tasks) throws FileSaveException {
throw new FileSaveException("Could not create the necessary directory for file save");
throw new FileSaveException("Could not save file to the directory.");
* Represents a deadline task, which is a task that must be completed by a certain date and time.
* @param title The name given to the task.
* @param time The date and time of the deadline.
* @param isComplete Indicates whether the task has been completed or not.
public Deadline(String title, Date time, boolean isComplete) {
* Constructs a Deadline task object with the completion status initialised to false.
* @param title The name given to the task.
* @param time The date and time of the deadline.
* Returns task name with the '[D]' prefix to identify it as a deadline.
* Represents a event task, which is a task occurring at a certain date and time.
* @param title The name given to the task.
* @param time The date and time of the event.
* @param isComplete Indicates whether the task has been completed or not.
public Event(String title, Date time, boolean isComplete) {
* Constructs an Event task object with the completion status initialised to false.
* @param title The name given to the task.
* @param time The date and time of the event.
* Returns task name with the '[E]' prefix to identify it as a event.
* Abstract class that represents a task, which has a name and a completion status.
* @param title The name given to the task.
* @param isComplete Indicates whether the task has been completed or not.
* Returns icon that represents whether the given task has been completed or not.
* @return '[X]' if task completed and '[ ]' if not.
* Marks the given task as complete.
* Marks the given task as incomplete.
* Returns the task name and indicates whether it has been completed or not.
* @return The task name with the completion status icon as a prefix.
* Responsible for adding and removing tasks from the list and performing operations on them.
* Constructs a new TaskList object with an initial list of tasks.
* @param tasks The initial list of tasks.
* Constructs a new TaskList object with no preexisting tasks.
* Returns the ArrayList of all tasks in the TaskList.
* Returns an ArrayList of all tasks with titles that match the given keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to be matched with.
* @return The ArrayList of all tasks matching keyword.
* Returns a task by the index corresponding to its position in a numbered list.
* @param index The index of the task selected.
* @throws TaskOutOfBoundsException If there is no task with the given index.
public Task getTask(int index) throws TaskOutOfBoundsException {
throw new TaskOutOfBoundsException("No task number " + index);
* Deletes a task by the index corresponding to its position in a numbered list.
* @param index The index of the task selected.
* @throws TaskOutOfBoundsException If there is no task with the given index.
public Task deleteTask(int index) throws TaskOutOfBoundsException {
throw new TaskOutOfBoundsException("No task number " + index);
* Adds the given task to tasks.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Thrown when a task referred to by index number does not exist in the TaskList.
* Represents a to-do task, which is a task with no date or time conditions.
* @param taskName The name given to the task.
* @param isComplete Indicates whether the task has been completed or not.
* Constructs a Todo task object with the completion status initialised to false.
* @param title The name of the task.
* Returns task name with the '[T]' prefix to identify it as a todo.
* Responsible for interacting with the user by receiving input and displaying output.
* Reads one line of input from the user.
* Stylises Duke output to be preceded by a divider. All Duke output is printed with this method.
* @param str The output to be stylised.
* Displays a divider line for style purposes.
* Displays a welcome message to the user with the Ace logo.
printWithStyle(logo + "\nHi, I'm Ace. What can I do for you?");
* Displays an exit message to the user.
* Displays all the user's current tasks in a numbered list form beginning at 1.
* @param tasks The ArrayList containing all user tasks.
printWithStyle("There are no tasks in your list.");
* Displays the user's tasks that match a keyword in a number list form beginning at 1.
* @param tasks The ArrayList containing all matching tasks.
printWithStyle("There are no matching tasks in your list.");
printWithStyle("Here are the matching tasks:\n" + strBuilder.toString());
* Displays error messages with the stylePrint() style.
* @param errorMessage The error message to be displayed.
* Displays that a task has been marked as complete.
printWithStyle("The following task has been marked as complete:\n" + task.toString());
* Displays that a task has been marked as incomplete.
printWithStyle("The following task has been marked as incomplete:\n" + task.toString());
* Displays that a task has been deleted.
printWithStyle("The following task has been deleted:\n" + task.toString());
* Displays that a task has been added.
printWithStyle("The following task has been added:\n" + task.toString());
* Displays how many tasks are currently in the user's list in sentence form.
System.out.println("You have 0 tasks in your list");
System.out.println("You have 1 task in your list");
System.out.println("You have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in your list");
